website_summaries.verdict: Very snug-fitting, a plus for those who struggle to keep their balaclava in place under a ski helmet.
pros: Fits snugly around the head, nose and chin
Doesn’t ride up during activity to block eyes or shift back from the forehead
Neck stays in place and protects well from the wind
cons: Some find the nose way too tight, and sunglasses may fog up when nose piece is in place

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is a life saver when I have to count the freezer at work. My ears & face doesn't freeze off.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Leseure

customer_reviews.title: Warm!  Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It was 37 degrees when we left Virginia heading to Florida. This kept my face warm, almost a little too warm. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wind Repeller!
customer_reviews.text: I love this balaclava, it's very warm, & cuts thru the wind nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Bob F.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Face Mask
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my neighbor and after receiving it, I was so surprised at how well crafted this face mask is that I will buy one for myself and my son too. It's very comfortable and doesn't go into your eyes. GearTOP also contacted me to find that I received my order is good condition. I'm happy that they care enough to ask for a small order. Will buy again from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can’t move very warm on a very cold windy day
customer_reviews.text: You can’t move very warm on a very cold windy day
customer_reviews.author: R. Grady

customer_reviews.title: Warm and great fit
customer_reviews.text: This balaclava keeps me warm and fits great under my cycling helmet. Used it this weekend on a 36 F bicycle ride. It was great! Actually got too warm after the first 12 miles. Slid the face cover down for a bit but was happy to put it back up going into a headwind. Finished up the 24 miles comfy and warm. Sure, you'll fog glasses with it over your nose but drop it just below your nose and no problem with fogging. Easy to breathe through it and it kept the cold wind from getting in. Easily adjusted with one hand to be able to drink from the water bottle while riding. Really happy with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: Spinmaster

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a sub zero warehouse environment for 12 hours a day. This mask has preformed fantastic in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Brett J Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Protection from the sun
customer_reviews.text: I used to slather on SPF sunblock before every outdoor activity, which was mainly hours of mowing the two plus acre yard each week. I had a large skin cancer removed a few years ago stretching from my nose and top lip. So preventing future recurrences became a mission for me. So I bought this cover, along with a very light weight white shirt wit long sleeves to wear mowing. Coupled with work gloves and my cowboy hat, the only thing visible are my eyes behind the sunglasses. This cover works well, is light weight and protective.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It works just like it says in the description.
customer_reviews.text: I have a big head and the Balaclava fit me perfectly. I use it to exercise outside in the cold. My head and face stayed warm on my run this morning without sweating. Overall the quality of the item seems pretty good with no noticeable manufacturing defects.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight, comfy and warm
customer_reviews.text: Was able to use this face mask at lake tahoe this past weekend, it definitely helped alot, since it was snowing/ raining really hard. So hard that I wasnt able to go snowboarding with it but there is always next time. You can really feel the material on these facemask, it feels super nice like its made out of really good material. You can use it for dust, snow, and the list goes on. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Is It Worth it?

customer_reviews.title: This balaclava performed great. It is a lil snug around the nose ...
customer_reviews.text: Went skiing at Blue Mnt. This balaclava performed great. It is a lil snug around the nose but I believe it is necessary to stay up. It didn’t fog up my ski goggles at all but I’m not sure how it would do with sun glasses but I think the snugness would help with that. But yeah I was warm all day. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Beil

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on my head
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on my head. The crown of my head measures 22 inches to give you and idea. It keeps my face protected from wind and mildly chilly temperatures. It's soft and comfortable on the inside and can be worn several ways. There may be other balaclavas for more frigid temperatures that may possibly be thicker, but this one works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Chompoonich

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. I’ll have to find a different one.
customer_reviews.text: The balaclava is small. Really small. I have a petite head- I often wear a child’s hood but this one barely fits. The headpiece only covers about 2/3 of my scalp. That is after you actually manage to get it over your head because it curls up when you put it on and won’t stay forward over your scalp. I would have loved the nice, thin fleece. It feels soft and warm but it’s useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: DaneMom

customer_reviews.title: Warm, fast drying and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This has a nice felt liner and dries fast. Very warm. One thing I wish they will implement into another version is a few small spots of rubber on the head. This would allow beanies worn over the balaclava to stay in place, as they tend to fall off due to the slickness of the fabric. Overall best balaclava I've owned though
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Too small. The pic makes it seem like ot comes down past the neck front and back. Not really. Unless your a kid. Barely fits my head. And very tight on the face. Ill give it to a kid i guess. Not worth the trouble to return. Dont buy for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: John maddy dotty harkins

customer_reviews.title: Not for biking below 65 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I bike 20 miles twice a week and was looking for something to keep the cold wind from my face, head and ears. Gave this balaclava a try in just 60 degree weather. Worthless. Glad I didn't wait until it gets down to the 40s. Used it as a full mask with goggles. Ears god cold as did my face. As for fogging the goggles, just a little and easy to correct. So, in short, it might be good at 70 degrees, but then I don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.Roman

customer_reviews.title: Made in Pakistan. Decent lightweight and thin face mask.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased: May 2020 Reviewed: May 2020 Made in Pakistan My Ratings: (I Only rates the product, not shipping) 5*Perfect (No issues) 4*Great (Minor Issue) 3*Good (Performs Function, May be better options) 2* OK (Limited functional performance.) 1* Do Not Buy Description: Pros: Multiple ways to use. Cons: A little bit of a chemical smell. I'll need to wash it and see if it goes away. Tips: None Manufacturer Recommendations: None
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Warm, light weight
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for our trip to Fairbanks, Alaska. It was below zero when we arrived. She wore it a couple times and it kept her face and neck warm. She had difficulty with the fit, but I don’t think it was anything wrong with the balaclava. Probably just a little big for her. If she decides she doesn’t want it, I’ll gladly wear it It was worth the buy. Plus, who doesn’t want to look like a ninja?!
customer_reviews.author: LHowell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: For something so light and thin it really DOES KEEP ME WARM on my cold-day motorcycle rides! The little extra nub of fabric for the nose is great when making the final adjustment after your helmet (FULL FACE) is put on and as I just said - this thing keeps me warm! Been using it as a mini scarf on days that are cool but not needing full face protection and it's done the job there too. Well done GearTOP!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: WARM but moist
customer_reviews.text: Kept me very warm worked well all the way down to -20 F. Their only fault is it traps moister in close to the face. I ended up often exposing my mouth and nose to not fog up my glasses but this caused an unforeseen issue. My mustache froze to the wet inside of the mask doing this. The result is lost whiskers. I partly blame my glasses for this happening because I think with out pulling the mask down I would think it would have just left me wet and unharmed but warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Metzinger

customer_reviews.title: Good for skiing, soft and surprisingly warm
customer_reviews.text: I like it, BUT if you have a large head like i apparently do (XL helmet size), the 'over-the-head'/hoodie part will be a very tight fit. No option of choosing different sizes so beware of this. The overlap on the side will be right on your ear, so if you are sensitive to pressure points, this may become annoying during a full day on the slopes. It wasn't too bad for me, but something that could have been designed smarter.
customer_reviews.author: SNielsen

customer_reviews.title: tight on big heads and a bit of a smell to it from new
customer_reviews.text: This balaclava has a fairly strong chemical smell, but it has faded some over time. Also, it is quite tight on me, but I use a helmet size 4XL. Be prepared to have marks from the seams on your forehead for 10 minutes after taking it off. It does make a really big difference when shoveling snow in minus 25 degrees and windy weather. However, I wish there was some mesh in front of the mouth part to let your breath escape, rather than letting it build up and become all soggy and cold.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Best Balaclava I could find, with nice contouring for the face covering
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different balaclavas to try out. This one wins. A little warm, but that's kind of the idea! I love how the mask is contoured to stay on your nose high enough for comfort and using with snowboard goggles, without restricting your vision below. I found the balaclava to be very comfortable, even when it got a bit wet, but it was a bit warm for the 40 degree days. The balaclava was a bit tight when worn with the face covering down at first, but it loosened up nicely after a half day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite.
customer_reviews.text: "I use this on my motorcycle and it works great! I have a few different balaclavas because I am a Scout leader and we camp out year round here in Michigan. The description says 2 free gifts; and mine contained none. However, the balaclava is well worth the price without the gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Whitner

customer_reviews.title: Eggsalad! Dope even.
customer_reviews.text: Great balaclava! I work outside in northeast winters and this is the best I've used. Bought a second though the first is still ok after 2 winters. If you have a giant head it may be too tight. For average to big heads, just give it time to break in and stretch. The materials used here are top quality. Stretchy and durable with a soft and warm inner lining. Unlike others that feel like plastic against your face. The only complaint I have is the back isn't long enough to tuck into my other gear. It does just about cover my neck. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mike seven

customer_reviews.title: Stitching looks good but unravels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use under my motorcycle helmet for semi-cold days. After only a few uses the bright yellow stitching started to unravel, leaving a large hole to the right of my mouth. My mother sewed the hole closed but I've noticed stitching unraveling from another area already. Now that I've had to restitch some of it the once flashy looking stiches just make it clear where I've had to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hamil

customer_reviews.title: Stretch Face opening is great
customer_reviews.text: Many of these are so tight that I can't open up the face and have to lift the whole mask from the bottom to either temporarily open or leave open to allow extra air flow if desired. These stretch and return to shape great. I also like that the top cap piece (it is attached) can be lifted back without taking off the whole mask when I take my helmet off so I can let my head/hair breath before I hit the snowmobiling trail again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W.

customer_reviews.title: Double stitched seams, good construction
customer_reviews.text: Well made, no loose threads, no excess cloth at seams, all seams are double stitched (helps prevent fraying from heavy use) and size shown in the picture is appropriate. It could use some extra cloth where your ears are and around the neck. Medium weight cloth. Delicate machine wash, or maybe by hand. Heavier weight cloth would be nice. Good for hunting in the snow but wear a white stocking cap too.
customer_reviews.author: FWIW

customer_reviews.title: Material Stretches to fast
customer_reviews.text: Issue I’m experiencing after using this for the first time during a 8 hour shift the material has stretched. So can’t cover my face without constantly pulling and readjusting every time I move my head. But this did work for a day now I can’t really use this anymore. After one time use the material stretches to much.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mohler

customer_reviews.title: Quality out of this era.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality. The sewing and the materials are out of this age. Perhaps back when Betsy Ross was sewing the first American flag, women vied to make sewn items perfect. GearTOP's Balaclava has no loose threads, no monkey tails of twisted threads; it's capital-C Clean finished. Patricia of GearTOP is conscientious to perfection and sees to it that her cusomers are satisfied to the popint of wanting more GearTOP products. The material is also remarkable, warm with a caressing handfeel. Patricia is going to build another Northface. Keep it up, Patricia! Victor
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: It keeps you warm and blocks the wind very well.
customer_reviews.text: Went on a winter ATV poker run. It was 19 deg. I was wearing a motto cross helmet with just goggles the Gear top kept me warm blocked the wind man I was really impressed. The real test will be this summer when i go riding the dead horse run. We,ll see if its to hot for the ride. I,ll let you know how that pans out then. OH forgot to say its not to tight on the head i have an average head size too.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey otten

customer_reviews.title: Smells BAD
customer_reviews.text: You know the chemically smell that seems to arrive on items shipped from certain overseas locations? Well this has it. Products with this chemical should not be allowed in America (or anywhere else for that matter). Will certainly not put something like this over my face!
customer_reviews.author: KEH

customer_reviews.title: Face mask works, hat - not so much
customer_reviews.text: This is defiantly warm. I'm not sure how to use the hat part of it. It doesn't fit my head like a hat should. It sits very high at/over my hair line. I have a super small head too - no fitted baseball caps for this girl - all are too big. Otherwise, it fits nicely and round my face - a perfect fit in terms of the face mask, which is all I really needed. It's not too tight, not too loose and keep the wind off your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Decently Crafted, Snug Fit.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected and what I wanted. Has made it through saving my lungs from camp fires, keeping my nose, ears, face, and even entire head warm when needed both camping and on motorcycle rides. Also fits snug enough to preserve my hair in the morning from the helmet impressions! Some loose sewing threads here and there but no falling apart yet. Awesome balaclava overall!
customer_reviews.author: xxMoffattxx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cold morning ride to work!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these in the morning when I ride my motorcycle to work. 35 degree rides are no problem at all. My neck and chin are comfortable, it's not to thick and comfortably fits under my helmet! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Boost918

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for those cold bike riding days
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid cyclist, the mask is great protection for your face in cold weather, although the nose area can be breathe thru, this face mask is perfect for cold wind. I wear under my helmet. When it gets warmer I pull it down a bit so it'll cover just the neck area. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: photomark

customer_reviews.title: Certainly keeps you warm and is totally serviceable.
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is the location of the head seam. It left a significant indentation on my forehead after removing my ski helmet. It wasn't particularly tight, and my husband's (different brand) doesn't have a seam in the same location. Not a huge deal, and didn't hurt, but a little embarrassing. Don't expect to be taking any photos after wearing this under a helmet.
customer_reviews.author: TWild

customer_reviews.title: actually, really nice
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time; new; & as advertised. i have a big head (23 in. circumf) & this fit me fine bought it for use under a paragliding helmet this has a smooth outer layer & a very thin mico-fleece inside layer i did experience some fogging of sunglasses while/with the nose/face guard on quickly remedied by pulling face part down but this will be perfect for cooler/chilly days that a 'full fleece' would be too hot for. great product. nicely made. & fits great. will also look for one without the micro-fleece so i can use during hot summer weather under helmet
customer_reviews.author: NJ shopper

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and another brand. Tried them both and preferred the other brand bought. This one has less neck coverage but more eye area coverage. It also had a chemical smell to it. The other one didn’t. I will keep it for a spare but would use the other brand definitely
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Product was exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly as expected. The fit was snug, but not tight. It was exactly as described. It would be even better if the cowl was a little longer, but I was NOT disappointed as previous reviews had made mention about the cowl length. I did cover my neck completely and had a little drape left over. I am using this as part of a costume (the rest of it is all white) and need to cover my face and neck. This fits the bill perfectly. I was able to breathe through the material without feeling suffocated and it was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: GGum

customer_reviews.title: Its perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have tria few and this one does not roll down when I put on my full face helmet. It had a chemical smell but I washed in the sink with only water and ket it air dry over night. The neck is long enough to block the wind. Kept me warm in 32 degrees going 65mph. The seams at the top will some getting used to. But I would rather have a pleasure point than frostbite neck.
customer_reviews.author: M.Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Fits well!
customer_reviews.text: So as soon as I received this , the weather warmed up! I'll come back and review it after I get to use it. The fit is great and I am happy as to how versatile it is. I can use it while cold weather bicycling, running, and skiing, not to mention chores and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition for under a motorcycle helmet in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition for under a motorcycle helmet in cold weather. Today was the second day in a row I rode the motorcycle into work. The temp in PA was ~50 degrees in the morning. This thing makes a huge difference in warmth when driving down the highway at 65mph. I wish I would have found this last year. I tried numerous other similar items to keep the wind off of my neck. I have stopped looking. This Balaclava keeps me warm on the motorcycle. It fits nicely under the helmet. Not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald D. Zuber II

customer_reviews.title: Repackaged second hand item. Generally when I purchase new ...
customer_reviews.text: Repackaged second hand item. Generally when I purchase new, I sorta expect a new unopened item. Also, picture is a bit misleading, throat portion does not extend much past the Adam's apple area when worn on the head.
customer_reviews.author: CTYankee9

customer_reviews.title: Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: This balaclava won't fit properly if you have a lot of hair. The most disappointing experience of this purchase is that it cost half the price of the product just to return it. Very displeased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Looks and seams fine.
customer_reviews.text: It looks and seam fine, tried it in, its snug on my head, but not to much and it’s loose on my neck, witch is good. Really have tried it, because it is warm out, bought it for when I am snow plow with my atv. But there is no snow. It seam to be well made. I looks like a nice product. To not heavy, but it’s not to thin either.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mid-weight balaclava!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty warm enough for the SF bay Area winters. I rode my bike last weekend when we reached a new low for the season: 27F. My head was warm, I wish I had my wind pants. I replaced a balaclava which was quite a bit lighter which was better for the shoulder seasons. I would call this a medium weight.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to put on. I wish the second layer on the top pulled down far enough to cover my ears with a second layer. I always wear a stocking cap with. Doesn't seem to get all nasty where I breath thru it. Has done it's job while walking dog during this very cold Nebraska winter.
customer_reviews.author: James Specht

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Its very nice. The fabric is soft and not scratchy at all. The fit is very nice also. But I'm not sure this would work out so well on a motorcycle in cold weather as wind/air goes right through it. So you'll need something else to block the wind instead, such as a jacket that zips all the way up.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Great face protection
customer_reviews.text: I really like this face mask and the soft material it's made with. I used it for snowmobiling and had to pull the front of the face mask down as I was getting too warm. The stitching and quality is great and after using it to see how well it is outdoors in the cold, I will be buying two more for my kids. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr65ss

customer_reviews.title: I love my new balaclava
customer_reviews.text: I love my new balaclava! I was really impressed with how it kept the cold wind out of my face while riding my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blizzard Beater!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this back in February right when the weather turned warm here in the North East but now I have gotten to use it skiing during the blizzard the last couple of days and I love it! Fit is snug but good since there are no wrinkles etc. when wearing under a helmet as I do. You can breathe comfortably through it when pulled up over your nose but still provides excellent warmth and wind protection. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: audinut

customer_reviews.title: I loved the fabric
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for our climb up Mt. Kilimanjaro. I loved the fabric, the fit, and the warmth and protection it provided from the elements. My only complaint with this item is trying to get it on! The cap portion was the most difficult section to retain in place while trying to pull it on. It definitely took some finagling and once I had it on I was loath to take it off knowing what a pain it would be to get back on straight! Other than that, I would recommend it, and will definitely use again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I only wish...
customer_reviews.text: I got this balaclava two days before it was supposed to arrive, which was awesome, it fits great for the way it was designed, which is fantastic, I bought it to be part of a costume, so the price was outstanding, I only wish there was some way to hook the middle of the forehead to the bridge of the nose to minimize exposed skin. I knew there wasn't when I bought it, I just thought I'd mention it as a future design idea, also its too bad you don't sell cycling outfits to match this design. Regardless, I am fully satisfied knowing that I got exactly what I paid for, keep up the good work folks!
customer_reviews.author: The Crimson King

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting, but stinks
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife and both of us thought it was well made and fit nice. Really fit nice. However, it smelled very strong of chemicals and my wife cannot wear it. Returning in rather than risking washing it and it not coming out and then not being able to return it. Really strange smell.
customer_reviews.author: EmTB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice no fuss mask for these times. Other masks I've made or tried move about and slight off, this one stays on and covers everything you need. Don't have to mess with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Coddick

customer_reviews.title: Great price, quality balaclava
customer_reviews.text: Fabric does a good job of allowing you to breath while keeping you warm. Used down to 0F - wouldn't want to rely on it for my ears for any length of time at that temp, but was fine for face. Built in 'cap' is interesting - there's a bunch of possible ways to wear it, I only use it as a balaclava.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: I used this balaclava for back country snowmobiling, I have looked and looked at high end brands for balaclavas. Figured i would try this one before i spend 65 $ on a KLIM one and I am glad I did. I used it this whole weekend with windy cold stormy weather and I was happy with it. Kept me warm, it was comfortable, seemed to dry out fast, for the price you cant go wrong. I am sure I will end up buying a few more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: the best Balaclava available
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased and worn many a Balaclava. I can happily dub this on the "best designed and made" I've ever encountered. fits well, even on my large noggin. the ability to pull back the crown and wear only as a nose and mouth cover is outstanding. fits comfortably under my bicycle helmet as well as my motorcycle, full head helmet. I'll be purchasing another for backup.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: great on my Atv ride
customer_reviews.text: bought this for riding on my ATV. It keeps my neck warm and clean from the dust of riding. I can wear goggles over the open section for your eyes. It is comfortable and will prove out warm as the fall riding weather approaches. The faster you go the colder you get so this will be the fixer.
customer_reviews.author: NB187

customer_reviews.title: It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my face away from the wind chill while I snowboard but it’s not too moisture wicking, it gets pretty soaked after a couple runs then freezes over. If you let it dry while you’re in the lodge then you’re fine, dries quick.
customer_reviews.author: C_Gtz

customer_reviews.title: Read my review
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking at this review and it's the year 2020 and this is the 50th mask you've looked at, just get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Keeps head warm in cold weather. Only down fall is it will fog up your visor while breathing but there is Nother product for 7 bucks to fix that
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D

customer_reviews.title: Too thin!
customer_reviews.text: Too thin! Would not recommend for under 40 temps or strong winds. It's okay, but I expected more warmth from it. Not very comfortable either,but it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Not very warm
customer_reviews.text: The bad: The picture makes it look like it's fairly thick and warm. It's not. It's thin. The first time out it was 34 degrees and I was on a bike ride. No wind. My scalp got very cold right away. It only works as an underlayer with a warm head covering on top. The good: it fits under a bike helmet and it doesn't cost very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item for bicycling
customer_reviews.text: I use this for bicycling when the temperatures get down to the 20s, and it is very effective. It is fairly (but not totally) wind resistant so it breathes pretty well while adding warmth. I still have to wear an additional warmer skull cap (I use the Gore windstopper) when temps are in the 20s, but that's no big deal because I'm already wearing the skull cap once the temperatures get down to the 40s and below. It is fairly thin so I find it much easier to layer than a fleece balaclava.
customer_reviews.author: SRez

customer_reviews.title: Great for most applications
customer_reviews.text: As a welder I wear this hood all day to protect my hair and face from sparks, metal debris, the elements and paint. While I'm aware this isnt what the product is intended for, it works extremely well for all the things I've listed. I've been using it for months and I've yet to have any holes, burn marks or issues. My one complaint is washing. No matter how hard I try, I cant get the paint out of this hood. Dont take that as a negative though as I'm not using it for what it's made for. Overall, excellent quality and very durable.
